table.name: Red River College Gold Medal
table.place: Applied Computer Education Department, Red River College
table.description: The Red River College Gold Medals recognize students in diploma  or degree programs who attain the highest cumulative grade point average at or above 3.80 in each academic year.

table.name: Applied Computer Education Academic Achievement Graduation Awards
table.place: Applied Computer Education Department, Red River College
table.description: Awards of $750 each will be presented annually, each spring, to students who have completed an Applied Computer Education program.  Recipients will be selected on the basis of outstanding academic achievement.

table.name: Owen Desnoyers Memorial Award
table.place: Applied Computer Education Department, Red River College
table.description: A minimum two awards valued at $1000 each will be available annually to students enrolled in the final year of a diploma, certificate or degree program at Red River College.  Eligible applicants will have attained a minimum GPA of 3.00; have been involved in the College community and contributed to student life at the College.

table.name: Honor Roll Certificate - Term 5
table.place: Applied Computer Education Department, Red River College
table.description: GPA 4.50

table.name: Business and Applied Arts Bursary
table.place: Red River College
table.description: Red River College award endowment fund for $1000, established in part from contributions from the Province of Manitoba's Manitoba Scholarship and Bursary Initiative, or from funds established at The Winnipeg Foundation.

table.name: Manitoba Scholarship and Bursary Initiative (MSBI) Bursary
table.place: Red River College
table.description: $3000 Manitoba Scholarship and Bursary Initiative bursary to assist study at Red River College.

table.name: Bell MTS Academic Excellence Award for Information Technology
table.place: Red River College
table.description: Two $500 awards will be presented annually to students in the second year of the Business Information Technology programs based on outstanding academic achievement in the first year of the program.

table.name: Co-operative Education Manitoba (CEM) Co-op Student of the Year Award
table.place: Co-operative Education Manitoba
table.description: Outstanding co-op student of 2020, evaluated by job achievement, academic achievement, student achievement, student’s personal statement, and student presentation.

table.name: Canada Life Awards
table.place: Red River College
table.description: Twelve $2500 awards are available annually to students who will be entering their final year. Criteria include financial need and a strong academic record (minimum cumulative GPA of 3.00), as well as volunteerism/community involvement.

table.name: Applied Computer Education Leadership and Community Awards
table.place: Applied Computer Education Department, Red River College
table.description: A recipient who show leadership in the College or community.  Applications must be accompanied by an essay describing (with examples) their leadership qualities in their family, College and community.

table.name: Applied Computer Education Academic Achievement Award for First-Year Students
table.place: Applied Computer Education Department, Red River College
table.description: Recipients who have completed the first year of an Applied Computer Education diploma program, on the basis of outstanding academic achievement

table.name: RRC Students' Association International Student Scholarship
table.place: Red River College
table.description: Four scholarships of $1000 each will be awarded to international students, attending a post-secondary Red River College program on a full-time basis. The scholarships will be presented to the students who attain the highest GPA after their first term; applicants must have achieved a minimum 4.00 GPA after first term. A first term grade report should accompany the application, as well as a one-page statement outlining your experience thus far in Canada and at Red River College.

table.place: Applied Computer Education Department, Red River College
table.description: GPA 4.50

table.name: Paterson GobalFoods Business Information Technology Award
table.place: Applied Computer Education Department, Red River College
table.description: Recipients will have achieved a minimum 3.00 GPA, demonstrated volunteer activity in the community and displayed a strong work ethic in class.

table.name: Honor Roll Certificate - Term 2
table.place: Applied Computer Education Department, Red River College
table.description: GPA 4.50

table.name: Applied Computer Education Research Awards
table.place: Applied Computer Education Department, Red River College
table.description: Applications must be accompanied by an essay describing their research project and conclusions.   Academic achievement is also considered.
